item.title: Openapi Discriminator With Go
item.description: I just recently solved a problem I had for a while. After winter holidays I decided to come back to it and solve it. I have a openapi schema, that documents and validates a small web app. It made use of the oneOf operator to allow different sub documents for some requests. However - when the request is slightly off for one of those sub document schema - none of those sub documents matches.

item.title: Setting up this blog
item.description: Just setup this blog real quick to give Hugo a spin and have a place to start. Just followed https://gohugo.io/getting-started/quick-start/ https://gohugo.io/hosting-and-deployment/hosting-on-github/ picked a theme https://docs.github.com/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pages/configuring-a-publishing-source-for-your-github-pages-site and after 15mins you can see your personal blog.
